body_html:
But it seems like the earlier version of dynamic _rnn was documented to stop early rather than trying the full time dimension. Was there a reason for the change?

Also @ebrevdo it seems that you can change the max time steps from step to step, but you can't actually have different max time dimension within a single batch for dynamic_rnn. But for the regular rnn function you can optimize per sample per step. Is this correct?
body_text:
But it seems like the earlier version of dynamic _rnn was documented to stop early rather than trying the full time dimension. Was there a reason for the change?
Also @ebrevdo it seems that you can change the max time steps from step to step, but you can't actually have different max time dimension within a single batch for dynamic_rnn. But for the regular rnn function you can optimize per sample per step. Is this correct?
body:
But it seems like the earlier version of dynamic _rnn was documented to stop early rather than trying the full time dimension. Was there a reason for the change?

Also @ebrevdo it seems that you can change the max time steps from step to step, but you can't actually have different max time dimension within a single batch for dynamic_rnn. But for the regular rnn function you can optimize per sample per step. Is this correct?
